title: Remote Growth and Development Education Program for Nurses

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing knowledge and completion of a three-year nursing major
context.additional_context: Designed for RN-BSN students who are practicing nurses (with 3-year degrees), considering the characteristics of adult learners balancing daytime work and studies

learning_goals: Learners can explain the developmental characteristics at each human growth stage—from infancy to adolescence—through online discussions and case analyses.
Learners enhance their ability to apply developmental theories to real-world clinical cases using a peer feedback system.

Over three weeks, learners use asynchronous content (3 videos, 2 simulations) and live video classes (weekly 90-minute sessions) to create self-directed learning plans (including goals, strategies, evaluation criteria) for ≥2/3 problem-solving scenarios, achieve ≥80% execution results, and submit a report meeting ≥4/5 instructor feedback checklist items.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
